oc8kkSFPDsago8OVHKOesw.text: I'm giving this place 3 stars, because, although the food is phenomenal, the service is awful. My hubby and I wanted to have a fish and chips night on Thursday this week and we chose this place based on its great reviews in Yelp. When we arrived to the restaurant, there was a line in front of the take-away counter, but we weren't sure if it was the take away line or the dining in line. I just wanted to look inside to see if there is a separate line within the restaurant, it wasn't, and while I was asking if the line was for the take away to a lady in the line, somebody, which turned out to be one of the waiters or owners of the place, told me to stop there and that they will call us when there is availability in an extremely rude manner. A moment later, he came back and told us there is a place for two and we became "eligible" to eat here. I saw the same guy shouting to other patrons as well about where they need to stand and when to enter the dining room. But how hard could it be to write a note to the front door saying that "The line start here, and wait for your waitress to be seated". As a first timer, how am I supposed to know what is inside our what the regulars do when they arrive. There is nothing I can say more about the food. It was delicious. Bread, butter and shrimp appetizer are served immediately. Hubby got the Master's Fish, and I got the haddock (? not sure). Both were very soft and tasty, and the portions were huge. We also didn't like the ambiance. Not that we expected fine dining experience, but the tables were very close and it was very loud! At first, we were ok with it, but then a big group arrived and were seated next to us. We were so close and we were almost the extension of their group. It was so loud, and my hubby and I finished our food very quickly even without talking to each other. We just wanted to leave and never come back. Again, if you are in for a great food with the softest fish & chips, order a take out and eat it in the park close by. Although we loved the food, I don't think we will ever go again.

GdhpBF9Usgho9ZMZ4s_8uA.text: Excellent fish and chips. The portions are huge so dont order any sides! The fish and chips were simple fried with a delicious tarte sauce on the side. The pickles were fantastic!! Best pickles ive ever had. Our female waitress was lovely and really sweet. The male waiter was a bit rude. Id skip on the mushy peas, they were literally just mushy peas. Free bread and cold shrimp but dont load up on it. Reasonably priced.

H9D6kyrRHDIJjY4txZ82FQ.text: Cod and chips to eat in was £8 and was a generous serving. Fish was beautiful, chips were ok, but could have been cruncher. Came with complimentary pickles, pickled onions, tartare sauce and tomato sauce, bread and little shrimps (which were ok). Takeaway cod and chips were a bit cheaper, we ate in. Was really busy and food still came out really fast.

D0G7i2ciBFNQv3SNneT48A.text: This is my favorite London chippy. The dine in option is, unlike most places, a good value, but takeaway is even more reasonable. The key to a good fish and chips (beyond using fresh ingredients) is the batter, which is especially well prepared here.

674V9HuExa_kTeoRGH4phQ.text: We had horrible Fish n Chips in Picadilly Circus on our first night. We asked the cabbie & he recommended this place. Boy was it good! The fish was plentiful for UK & US standards. If you go anywhere in UK, the portions are half the size of a US portion. The batter was thick and crispy but the insides were moist & tender. Fries were just excellent and not soggy at all. Like a lot of family businesses, they're closed on Sundays so make sure you go during the week! This place is a must-try if you're in London, for sure.

JX33jNsz7Z759XZfn5lWPA.text: Very popular on a Friday night. Not sure if that's anything to do with Catholics having fish suppers on Fridays or more to do with Pensioners celebrating the weekend. Either way, turn up early if you want to get one of the plastic-topped tables and not just stand in the take away queue.As the other reviews say, this place does great Fish and Chips and feels proper bonafide London through and through. Pickled onion with your plate sir? We had a lovely crispy whitebait starter and satisfyingly bright-green mushy peas. Our cod and chips (regular size) were too large to finish but golden crispy and delicious. I particularly loved their chips here. We also had a special of grilled sea bream which was fantastic and a massive portion given the price of a tenner. You'd get half of the fish for 20 quid anywhere else and it'd be ruined by some french sauce, so hats off to master superfish for cooking it right. Highly recommended timewarp fish and chips. Their signs still have their phone number beginning '071...' which means they've not bothered updating them since before 1995.

bsmU3YkKfqvFNYgyi1nwVw.text: Great spot, a little off the beaten path but worth the walk.  I found this place on Yelp and I walked here twice from Trafalgar Square and was rewarded each time.  The fish and chips were the best I experienced in London.  A full portion was only five pounds which is less than half what you would pay in a tourist area.  If you're looking for fish and chips this is the spot!

5wMTgL_e2Cvbh-k_moeLAQ.text: Best fish and chips I've ever had.  I dined out and ate at a bus stop because my time was limited.  Next time I will probably dine in.  Because there WILL be a next time.

SoRGlCX-hCN1OUYbQlNm6A.text: Visiting London, we had to eat fish and chips.  The first place we went to couldn't serve us fish and chips because the fish monger never came to deliver it.  It was sunny that day, and we believed he was out basking in the sun at the park.So we asked around and a waitress recommended this place and did they place hit the spot.  Might I add, my husband was very skeptical and believed "it's just fried fish.  You can get it anyway and probably better". I ordered the lunch time special with tea or coffee for 6.50 pounds.  I got traditional cod and he order something the waitress recommended plaice.  The cod was juicy and flakily while the batter crisp and non-greasy.  His was a much flatter fish, but large in size and had great flavor.  What made it really great was the tartar sauce.  They gave us a big bowl of it along with some boiled shrimps.  My shrimps even had additional bonus, they were filled with eggs.  My husband enjoyed it very much.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Juicy cod w/ chips
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. boiled shrimps and bowls of tartar and cocktail sauce!
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom

AKdhPHHkleujog324ww38w.text: The food was good and plentiful! I had cod with chips. Really enjoyed the pickle and onion too. Go eat it.

wYgluosux9rIhuOmTozkDQ.text: Got take out here,  food was decent, good price.  The homemade tar tar sauce is nice but they almost give you too much for even two servings. Portions are pretty generous, coming from Canada this was a perfect fish and chips fix.

T4iMWsdKRRrxw3u_YFxbbQ.text: Visited here while on vacation last week and was not disappointed. My wife who had tried and was disappointed with fish & chips at a pub earlier in the week came away from this place with a smile. The outside of the fish was nice and crispy while the inside was moist and flakey. This place is just down the road from Waterloo station so don't miss it.

jWrDoiQzaKCvsgZnFqPlYQ.text: If you ever wondered whether a restaurant's interior could make you feel depressed, a dinnertime visit to Masters Super Fish will confirm that it definitely can! Just along busy Waterloo Road, Masters Super Fish is a real hole-in-the-wall. Walking in during dinner time, the restaurant was mostly empty, except for a few tables of men who were eating by themselves. If you go, get takeout or maybe try lunchtime.Onto the food. The cod fillets are huge--unlike a lot of fish and chips places in the U.S. that give you several pieces, here you get one dinner plate-sized fillet. The fish was incredibly fresh and flavorful, as promised. The breading came crispy but with all the fish juices, the bottom was soggy by the time I got to it. But the cod was really good! Chips were not consistent--some were crispy while others were soft and potatoey. Best to go for the fish and peel off the fried stuff.

jmwWHdfiWltMcQeIR4wQDw.text: Some tasty and reasonably-priced fish and chips! I suggest sticking with the cod for fried fish, the haddock was a bit dry.

67AlPU9SwBPFqzdOeMttcQ.text: What I ate on a Tuesday about 8.30pm4 Shell-Prawns, Picked Onions, Gherkins - ComplimentaryAll dine-in customers received a few prawns and some bread and butter to tide them over until the main event arrived. We appreciated this as our mustard and pepper fish took a very long time to prepare. Onions and gherkins were chilled, crunchy and vinegary.Masters Skate Fried in Pepper - £9.25 (includes chips)This huge fleshy skate wing was covered in a fine black pepper and fried perfectly, the dense flakes peeled wonderfully off the spiny bones making the crispy skin and juicy skate a delicious mouthful. The pepper crust would have hugely benefited from seasoning with salt and lemon as this had to be liberally and constantly applied. Because of the density of the fish and it's peppery jacket the skate retained heat, the last bite as delicious as the first.Masters Cod Fried in Mustard - £9.50 (includes chips)The strong mustard flavour worked perfectly with chunky cod and was seasoned very well, we preferred this dish to the skate as there was less hassle with self-seasoning. Chips on both were good, crispy but lacking a smooth puffy interior. We ordered haddock but they only had cod left, with cod depletion issues it is a shame it was not the other way round.Mixed Salad - £2.00We were too full for this so it came home with us. Even so it was not the most appealing salad, a few leaves, grated carrot, tomatoes and tonnes of sliced raw onion.Mushy Peas - £1.50Chunky, thick and tasty, served in a sensible sized portion for two to share. The addition of salt, vinegar and pepper made it irresistible and it was finished off pretty quickly.Drink4 Pots of Tea - £4.00Tea was fine but the milk was UHT and spoilt the taste.AtmosphereWe sat in but there is also a takeaway window for speedy visits. The dining room is clean (if a little chilly) and showcases a wonderful mix of customers. We joined single cabbies who all seemed to order the Master Special (247g prime cod), a family, a couple and a few business men with overnight trolleys straight from Waterloo station (3 mins walk away).OffersLunch Special - Cod/Plaice/Huss with tea or coffee/soft drink - £6.50/£7.00 (with chips)VerdictGO!We will definitely return when we feel we can take the calories of a battered fish. Looking at other tables made us pretty jealous as the majority had ordered the huge crunchy fish that curled up off their plates however we really enjoyed our meal and left satisfied.

iY-T5DC75Wvc84RwwZQVWw.text: The portions are huge. The fish is perfectly fried on the outside, nice and fresh on the inside. Not too greasy. The free bread and tiny shrimps are nice too.

Ssa1ZFxmhiWCZKtF2-X63A.text: This is hands down the best Fish and Chips in London. It is worth detouring to if you're not staying nearby.

4YqMya8ZEkTf_eHDIRQutA.text: We were looking for a great fish and chips place.  Yes, it's divey.  Our clothes smell of fried food after dinner.  Still, the fried fish was really great and the mustard pan-fried cod was spectacular.  The french fries were acceptable but a little dry and tough.  The mushy peas needed something--butter and/or salt, maybe.  The cole slaw salad was good.  We thought Masters was very, very good--but not as good as Robin Hood Pub in Sherman Oaks, IMHO.

zsbJZlRU0bnoLIEbWwycVQ.text: Very popular place and I was surprised by how many locals were here.  Thought it was going to be full of tourists like us, but happy to see many neighborhood folks here.  Good fish and other items (pretty much all fried).  Service was decent and the food plentiful.  Okay for families too.  Would return if I lived here or visit again.

Jbh59qSPo23r6tqvMo4fzA.text: I've been popping into this place for fish & chips on my way home from work every few weeks recently. Fantastic cod & generous portions. Nice touch with the pickled onion & gherkin on the side. Will definitely keep returning as it's consistently good.

sTHy-xwo3JtCzMzWy2oOcw.text: Total dive, but boy, was it good! We ate here on our last night in London, as it was right by the hotel & we had not yet experienced fish & chips. We arrived just before closing, but were greeted by the friendly waitress, who did not act at all put upon by our late arrival.The portions are huge, and I do mean HUGE. We easily could have split 1-2 meals among the three of us. Unfortunately quite a bit of food was wasted, but at least their prices are extremely reasonable!

fYNhu4pTSKTS2WpmRRN1uQ.text: The real deal. If you're American and grew up with the Van De Kamp's fish sticks, you'll probably pass out when you see the size of this mother of all fish fillets. It's fresh and you should never have them put this fine piece of fish in a bag for eating later. It's imperative that you sit down, order a beer and enjoy the shrimp, lager and wait for this fine fish.I walked over 1.8 miles each way to enjoy the halibut. Worth every step.

2H3A-q3kJZQ4T1jKaRqa9g.text: This is great, totally authentic, London fish and chip shop. It's a great place to get takeaway fish and chips on a rainy Thursday night, and the portions are enormous. We generally get a normal sized cod and chips to share between two and have still had leftovers often enough. The cod is soft, flaky and delicious, and fried to order right in front of your eyes, so it takes a couple of minutes, but it's totally worth it. You can also call it in, which cuts down the waiting time.The only negative is that unfortunately it isn't open Sundays, which in our house is the prime take-out night and when we would go most often, but alas, we cannot.

2RczqHEBM7kvpsT7u-R7WA.text: My first fish and chips in London. It was pretty good and the service was good as well. The ambiance could be improved but overall not a bad place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. The classic, fish and chips

dqaFZvdYfv8k_owT7US49g.text: Please indulge me for a moment while I post this public apology:I'm sorry, nice lady sitting in the Eurostar waiting room and quiet guy next to me on the train.My fish and chips must have smelled incredible.  I really hope you weren't hungry.  And I apologize for how gross it must have been watching me devour them in front of you, hastily package them back up to run to the train, then finish the feast in my seat.See, I had to carry them in the Tube across the city and just barely made it to the train in time - and I couldn't wait any longer to eat.  It would be a travesty to let food this delicious get cold.But know this: if we had actually spoken about it, you would have known that it was so worth it.For Yelpers, take note that it is much, much easier to find this place from the Lambeth North station than from Waterloo.At the Take-Away counter, you can actually watch them cook the food.  It is literally "grab cod filet, bread it, then immediately fry it".  £5.00 for the regular size cod and chips in a paper bag.  None of the sides and condiments mentioned in the sit-down reviews are included but they really aren't necessary.Three different people tried to take my order.  While they were rather... abrupt... in their approach, they seemed to sincerely appreciate the business.  The kind of people who look you directly in the eye when they speak.  Left a very positive impression.Fish was incredibly delicious, perfect combination of the fresh fish flavor with the saltiness of the breading.  Chips were some sort of sweet variety of potato.  Had them with only salt added.  Forced myself to stop eating them before my stomach exploded.If only this place weren't 5000 miles away...

pPLwK7hiA4qJDxRd91QcMA.text: Excellent fish and chips! The best I have tasted. I am visiting from USA and this is must to try staple food of Brits. It's not fancy place and I ordered take out but I loved the authenticity and quality. I love meeting local Brits. You have to try it if you visit London.

Zh-v1yRhJWokEHIJzvtUEg.text: Large portions. Had takeaway so cant comment on dining in. Everything was freshly cooked so nice and crispy. Had 2 try the english fish and chips and the was a good option. Cheap too.....5£ for a regular size 6£ for the giant sized cod. Good deal

C2WDMF4nqcqerqtze_U6dA.text: A lot of the previous reviews on here have nailed it: The fish is moist and flaky on the inside, while crispy and not oily on the outside. I didn't care for the "chips" very much, but I don't like the thicker cut English fries as much anyways.The lunch special is a good deal and a HUGE portion of fish and chips.

8x3mU3MkKrBZbtD4Bsq0sg.text: As a newbie traveler, I am seeing for the first time just how much work and preparation goes into planning out a trip. Especially since I am traveling solo, preparation and planning are key to ensure that I maximize my time spent in a city while minimizing the amount of time spent waiting on lines or wandering about hopelessly lost. I found Traveladvisor particularly useful, as it guided me in my decision-making process of which sites to head to first (get to the Tower of London when it opens and see the Crown Jewels as soon as you enter to beat the lines) and what time to arrive at certain sites (get to Buckingham Palace more than an hour before the 11:30 start time of the Changing of the Guard if you want to get a good view at the palace gates). Similarly, Chowhound is my go-to resource for learning about which restaurants and dining establishments are worth trying out. Travelers commonly ask for restaurant suggestions and recommendations with the caveat that they want to go to "where the locals eat." In researching which London restaurants serve the best fish and chips, one name that kept coming up as a place frequented by cabbies and locals alike was Masters Super Fish. With a name like that, I knew that I just had to check it out, and in the end, I was really glad that I did. After spending my first morning in London exploring the Tower of London and Tower Bridge, I arrived at Masters at about 12:15 to a sparsely filled dining room with a couple of tables occupied by what appeared to be locals. With my order of the lunch special fish and chips placed, it was only a minute later that I was served a complementary trio of boiled shrimp. These things were tiny, but hey, they were free, so I guess I can't complain. About ten minutes later, my plate of fried cod and chips was served, along with a helping of pickled onions and a pickle. Now, again, as my last post on fish and chips stated, I am by no means a fish and chips expert, but I found the fish and chips at Masters to be pretty fantastic. The fish was obviously freshly fried, and the golden brown, craggy crust was pleasingly crisp and not greasy in the slightest. I think I may prefer the thinner crust found at Luke's over the thicker-crusted fish at Masters, but that's just nitpicking, as the fish was really quite impressive with a moist and flaky interior. The batter was tasty and not soggy in the slightest, and the chips, fat and crisp, were far superior to Luke's, which were a bit pale and flaccid (that's what she said!). When doused with some malt vinegar and eaten with the pickled onion to provide some acidity, the fried cod at Masters was a work of art, indeed.Masters is the kind of place where you will get honest-to-goodness delicious food that is far enough off the beaten path that it isn't swamped by tourists. It is the type of place that has a steady flow of customers who live in the area, and it's exactly the kind of place that I am looking for when I want to eat as the locals eat: a nondescript, neighborhood restaurant offering good food that I can't get back at home in the US. If I lived anywhere near Masters, I would make a return trip. Alas, my short weekend jaunt in London did not allow me to return, and with several other restaurants on my to-do list, I did my best to savor every last bite of the terrific fish and chips. Masterful, indeed.

NP3hJOBaPZLAOOrsqgeEgg.text: Hole in the wall fish and chip place, packed with regulars, locals, and tourist.  The fresh fluffy batter set this place apart from the other fish and chip place I've had while in England.  The portions are huge!  One order can easily satisfy two people.  The fish itself is fresh and the prices are reasonable.  Only downfall might be it's aging interior, but hey you come for the food, not the ambience right?

vbp-uHzLFHvZL20-RXAFgA.text: The best fish and chips I have ever had! The breading was light and flaky with just the perfect amount of greasiness. The waiter was excellent and brought out bread and shrimps. The chips were big and crispy and complimented the perfect fish. Nice little clean hole in the wall, highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Cod fish and chips
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom

UW2ZskKwuYlth9kOBX3vuA.text: Nice locals place. Fish (cod) and chips were quite good. Served with a load of tartar sauce and ketchup if you needed them. Malt vinegar at the table as well of course. Very inexpensive & large portions.Steer clear of the other menu items however. The pickle spear & pickled onions tasted like they used industrial vinegar and cleaning fluid. Gack. Deserts were disappointing as well. Rum raisin ice cream tasted like it was made with embalming fluid. Horrid. Sticky pudding was hot & sticky, but that is about it.Decent fish & chips, but not epic. Not worth a special trip.

Sliz_zl410KXqZ58G_5b9A.text: The fish and chips was okay... Greasy and very little seasoning, as the dish is well known for. Its the grilled sea bass that amazed us here! Juicy, fresh fish grilled to a tender perfection! The grilled fish options are a tad bit pricier than the fried ones (around 11-14 if I remember correctly), but SO worth the experience! Have to knock down a star for the shitty attitude though.

8A-VBJEcRmiWDBoZhEsOlA.text: As good as it gets. Good fish, lovely taste, not overly greasy, fantastic portions (Master's special is HUGE), and nice guys working the kitchen. It's all done to order, so expect it to take 5 minutes or so to cook up -- well worth the wait.If the weather is nice enough, you can save a few quid by ordering takeaway from the kitchen window (you'll see it when you go through the front door) and walking a block north to the park to enjoy your meal -- ordering takeaway is cheaper by £1-2.

wRWHgljwMpk1lokksx8eNw.text: Good food.  Loved the fried cod.   Grilled fish is just so so.   Surprisingly the Singapore noodles was quite good.  Definitely recommended.

l1wBIlf-8kR0bgUPOuNxsA.text: Not a terrible fish and chips place. Very quick and convenient, good breading on the fish. Get takeaway and find a place with a breeze if they're super busy.

XOUJxlL1-2LckqHjA0K9yA.text: Yum!Came here while on holiday in London. We arrived around 6pm and there were a lot of senior citizens also enjoying their dinners - perhaps it was a thing for all of them to come at once?The portions are huge and the prices are reasonable. All of us ordered the fish & chips. The batter was v. light and crisp and didn't peel off of the fish like it sometimes does at poorer quality places. The chips were good and the fish was tender. They give you complimentary bread and butter and huge dishes of ketchup and tartar sauce to go with your fish & chips.Ambiance is casual and clean and the service was friendly.

QK_5FPbb6T2sSgP0eoAKCQ.text: I spent a good amount of time trying to decide where I could get the best fish and chips during our time in London and settled on Masters mostly based on the pictures posted.It didn't disappoint! Hubby got the large (LARGE! nearly falling off the edge of the oval plate!) cod special and I got the haddock. They didn't ask about batter type but when the food arrived the cod had the classic golden crispy batter while my haddock was a lighter mustard-based crust. The waiter said if I didn't like it they could change it, but this way we could try a couple different things. And this is what I would recommend - the mustard was a nice touch and the batter itself very light. Their classic batter was delicious! Slightly sweet with perfect texture. Our fries were good, more golden/done as I noticed the couples' next to us were very light and not so appealing.Overall pretty good prices as far as London goes. It's small, cramped and homey inside. Not quite dirty but there were some flaky fish bits on the chairs. Plenty of tourists and locals eating in and steady to-go traffic as well. Solid place!

EeaY2rnt8AIrm6SrRu5QlA.text: The service was awful!  When we got our food and had eaten, another large group came in to the restaurant.  My daughter went to the counter and asked for our check so we could leave after a long day of sightseeing.  The waitress was rude and refused to give her the check saying she was very busy.  The grilled halibut was not good.  Would not recommend it!

XF-dZj09ehB5goy2Crc4Iw.text: Five stars for the fish, three stars for the chips. Average of 4! The place has a local charm sand nice servers. Definitely recommend it if you're staying on the south side of the Thames.  The beer choice could be better, but that's a consistent theme in the UK.

L2d8pemqmaZOA8SPtNkUNg.text: The fish and chips here are just ok nothing special. I wouldn't go out of my way next time to check out this place

iIBOSq4z6cVSKkpxowFWQQ.text: Dropped in here after waiting forever across the bridge at the first fish and chips I stumbled upon. Quickly resorted to my Yelp app to find Masters so highly rated. Off I wandered to find a bit of a dive with a few Asians working the counter - not the amazing fish and chips I was imagining, but I trust Yelp, so...Waited a bit but was served bread/butter and a few whole shrimps (gratis). This was a nice way to warm up to what was next. Lemonade was clear, interesting, but good - I thought it was water at first. Looked over my shoulder in the kitchen and saw a real English chap preparing the food so I calmed down a bit. A bit later they brought over a HUGE piece of cod with chips, pickles and onions. The fish was steamy-hot and soft inside, crispy outside - it was basically perfect.... and about half the price of the other shop I visited.Needless to say my plate was clean, my belly full and my first fish-n-chips experience in England a wonderful memory. If you're in the area, don't miss 'em!

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Yup, good as it looks!

sIXSlExma4QMJZgdJnAjRw.text: I would recommend this place to anyone going to London, looking for a real fish & chips experience!My mom and sister both got the Cod and I ordered the Superbites (sampling of 4 kinds of fish). It was delicious! There was one fish on my plate that just melted in your mouth. I have no idea which one it was since they were not labeled... But it was the 2 thinnest pieces of fish on the plate (I received about 8 pieces in my order.) The fries were hit or miss depending on which ones you ate since they varied in shape, size and therefore also varied in "done-ness". If you sit down you get little shrimp which are seasoned well, the tarter sauce, ketchup, malt vinegar, and the pickles (a pickled cucumber spear & half an onion). If you get the food to go it is cheaper, but I'm guessing you don't get any of the thing listed above in the to-go orders.The service was not at all warm, but for the amazing food it still earns 4 stars!

5zUpTKqNtu1RCSmjXZKRfw.text: This casual dining spot had a "hole-in-the-wall" feel that was just what we were looking for. Everything that we had was good, the portions were generous, and the staff was great!

mexm5rjh77o7qm6l0mgc0g.text: Had this place on my list so wanted to check it out for myself and glad I did.Lunchtime special of fish and chips (choice of cod, haddock and others) plus cup of tea. £6.95The chalkboard menu has sea bass, plaice and other fish served with 1/2 chips and 1/2 salad and didn't even study the rest of the menu but noticed desserts on there too.There's a takeaway counter on entry and sit down cafe through the doors. Complimentary very fresh bread & butter and prawns - much appreciated thanks.My cod and chips was just right for a lunch portion (not too massive) and really one of the best I've had. First off, the fish. The batter here is the more substantial and crunchy kind which I like best and the fish inside was just perfectly cooked, I mean perfect. What does that mean? It means, first  that it's super fresh and second that it's cooked to exactly the right point where the white flesh quivers into gentle, super moist flakes, against crunchy, ungreasy, flavourful batter. A culinary match made in heaven when it's just right. Further bonus that the cod is skinless which I like.Chips had just the right size, texture and light crispiness on the outside, yielding on the inside.and...pickles (gherkins and onions) and sauce boats of  tartar sauce and ketchup are offered to help yourself on the side. Never ketchup for me on fish and chips, just plenty of salt and vinegar. The tartar sauce was good.Almost forgot...a proper pot of tea and jug of milk round the whole thing off. What more could a guy want?So simple so great, such good value for £6.95.If you want fancy dining and ambience,  go elsewhere. If you want honest to goodness food and no BS, come here.

vN9WscbrcD23a4ihmQQCyQ.text: Took my son here on a whim one afternoon when visiting London.  Great fish at a good price. Nothing fancy but you will not be disappointed.

4-1T_5_wTIfUVrp51KChDA.text: Arriving for an early dinner, the place is already packed with locals and tourists; which is always a sign of a good restaurant. Masters Super Fish offers a wide selection of fish to choose from (cod, plaice, huss, scampi, haddock and skate). I decided to choose the traditional cod fillet (£7.25). The dish was plated with the piece of fried cod served with tartar sauce, ketchup, a slice of lemon and bite-sized chips. The waitress also offers diners complementary side options of pickles and pickled onions table side upon service of the meal. The first cut into the cod you can hear the crispiness of the batter. The cod was flaky, buttery with a light crunchy batter that makes a perfect bite. The chips had a crispy exterior, yet possessed a soft interior. Overall the fish and chips were the best I had on the entire trip in the UK.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Cod and chips

kXhj8UlwhgRrbLFqzITTlw.text: I returned for the grilled fish. My sea bass was not filleted. Imagine my shock. Service is still pretty good. Cannot improve upon earlier 3 stars...I wanted to.

PKCRxZzLit7ZdJoXBujIzw.text: Went here for some fish and chips while visiting London. The fish was good quality and the portion sizes were very generous. Atmosphere is a bit hectic because the place can be busy but the staff are very friendly and attentive. Definitely recommend.

gyOSlh_8mInXIESM1En9KQ.text: Best fish and chips I ever had. A must stop. I got the masters special. My husband and I were able to get full off of it with chips remaining. Loved the pickles. Food is definitely good. Makes up for the not so friendly waitress. She was getting frustrated with us and asked if we were ready to order yet when she never came to say hello or even offered to get us our drinks. I didn't know it was a bother to have customers. If service was better, definitely a 5 star joint.

KoXPi-9RpjPFhOMrPe1GWA.text: We stopped here after a walking tour with our guide. It's definitely off the beaten path, with more locals than tourists. I love eating at places like that when I travel.The cod and chips were the best I've ever had. The cod was really crispy on the outside and super succulent on the inside. The chips were also crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Don't forget to splash some malt vinegar over everything.I would definitely recommend coming here for the fish & chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Cod & Chips
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom

5H8K6qtnAMMfY_QYd9STiA.text: This place is a steal! For their price point, you get a very crispy and non-greasy cod fillet with perfectly fried chips. The tartar sauce that comes with is also pleasantly balanced and not overly briny, as you might find in the States when shops try too hard to recreate it. The textures were lovely and the flavors well managed. Their desserts were good, too -- but if you want to try their banoffee ice cream pot do so early as they may run out!Be forewarned -- if you're looking for fine dining, this isn't the place. But if you're looking to have amazing fish and chips in a more authentic setting, hit up MSF.

7uLlSOr5UXZCPN7-dCcWWw.text: Personally, it is expectation not fulfilled here :-( Perhaps I expected much because of the many great reviews. Personally, I thought the food was "alright," nothing special worth raving really. The fish was huge and the batter was average. The chips were cut medium size and not soggy. The dining area is clean but lacking of beauty whatsoever. The service was prompt and friendly, while the price is cheap.  Overall, its not bad but not good either.

0A2ZKkupKvm2-DRBTE61xA.text: We went here because our taxi driver recommended it. The ambiance isn't the greatest but the fish and chips were good. I can't remeber which fish I ordered but i think it might be the master special. Huge piece of fish. It's a huge piece that still had skin on one side so I think it might be fresh fish. The batter is so crispy and fluffy looking. My fish stayed crispy til the end. I'm not sure what fish they used but it was s nice white fish that was not fishy. It tasted almost creamy

xCqfchijI7aFiPwAxIsJAQ.text: Rare London chip shop with excellent value (delicious and fair price)!At 5 quid for a cod and chips, this shop offers the cheapest takeaway in the area, which is great. But it's also the most delicious -- fish is perfectly (read: also freshly) fried, and chips are crispy, not like eating a mound of friend mashed potatoes.

Q0Bf66OGkHod68FtTgl2Tg.text: Food was amazing, but the service was pretty dire and very unfriendly. Didn't even understand what a battered sausage was.. Sauces were cheap and drinks were small. Real let down.

Q3ROqcbj6I4N2ALFAVPEug.text: I've not had and fish n chips elsewhere in the UK,  but this is easily one of the best fish n chips I've ever had. I had the cod. It was thick and super flakey! The chips were crunchy on the outside, but thick n meaty on the inside. It's not a pub, it's not a fancy restaurant. The people here are nice though, and the food (a lot of it) makes up for anything else!

ipPQUu2d89uchYvwwLJC-w.text: This is the best fish and chips in London! So happy I've found it. The classic order of cod and chips is great value and melt in the mouth delicious. I have also tried the order where you get a platter of small pieces of all the different types of fish (plaice, salmon, cod, etc) instead of ordering one big piece of fried fish. I actually didn't like it at all, as the piece sizes are small and when gives you mostly a mouthful of fried batter. My favourite part of the cod was the tender and flaky insides, so I highly recommend just getting that, as it's a good portion and lets you really enjoy the the fish, not just the batter.

0n5W2umIpTXuN_653R5joA.text: AMAZING! The fish is HUUUUUGGGGEE. I've never seen fish and chips so large! It was crispy and succulent. Delicious. I'm not sure what else there is to say about the food!!FYI the area Southwark is NOT pronounced South-wark, but rather Southerk. My UK friends did not hesitate to poke fun at my American pronunciation! =)

C0dC0bO5_-D8OkiGuGPJjw.text: I LOVE fish and chips! This for me was fish and chip heaven. The portions huge, delicious and made to order. During my three day stay in London I ate  takeout from there everyday. It truly doesn't get any better than this for fish and chips.

-DH9bCW5zmw34K7jdSuwVA.text: Yumm! I can't wait to visit this place next time I'm in London!

EiW3YGsF95A1l2NXrNOY_g.text: disclaimers:*i was warned by friends to not try fish and chips in the UK.*masters super fish had pretty high ratings on yelp which made me want to try it even more. *asian staff anywhere around the world are the same. rude and unfriendly. (i can say this because i am asian and i've experienced bad service at many asian restaurants in my day). so with that being said there was an asian female staff that totally was rude and unfriendly. dislikes:*flat room temperature coke*the cold shrimp they give you*service was pretty awful.ordered:*fish and chip (cod)- 7.50 - thick cut fries with no seasoning. personally i prefer shoestring fries and yes i know fish and chips in the UK is thick cut. just wished there was some type of seasoning. fish was a little crispy on the outside edges besides that it was a bit oily and also lacked flavor. putting ketchup on it definitely helped a great deal! overall, i came into masters super fish with no to little expectations. i walked out somehow still disappointed because i really wanted to be proven wrong. i really wanted to like it. tips:*they have a take out window and an actual restaurant *cash *serves alcohol*has a kids menu*no wifi*restroom is available for customers.*indoor seating only

Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Menu

netfczKLE-2OX6J2pvAlLA.text: This place is a few blocks from the Waterloo station. Easy walk :) Had their lunch special and it was thumbs up! It was a HUGE piece of fish, perfectly deep fried. Super crispy - without a doubt they fry it when you order. I watched them from my seat.Service was good - very attentive. Restaurant was clean and had strong a/c (strong a/c is rare in London). Great value and food.

wCSex8jLGbJhSvr6PxJq-A.text: The best so far!  On a family trip to London, I'm using the excuse of searching for the best fish and chips as a way to explore the city.  This is definitely the best so far.  The cod filet was huge, easily 50% bigger than those of other shops.  The fish and the batter were both tasty and perfectly cooked.  The chips were crispy, not soggy.  The service started with a complimentary dish of shrimp and bread and butter.  A generous serving of tartar sauce and ketchup was provided.  After serving our plate, the waitress passed by with complimentary garnishes of gherkins and pickled onions.  The servers were polite and friendly.  It was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Huge portions, plus complimentary gherkin and pickled onion.  The chips were crispy.  The fish and batter were tasty.  Kudos!
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. The best so far in our quest for the best fish and chips in London
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Complimentary shrimp, bread and butter to start

i-iA2ndNsW45sWCEYCN_lA.text: Coming to London, I really wanted to try authentic fish and chips and see what all the craze was about. This place popped up on Yelp as one of the top places for the specific dish.It's a small little restaurant, not too far from the Waterloo station. You walk in and seat yourself. Service leaves much to be desired. They weren't particularly rude, just not friendly. When we sat down, the waiter gruffly asked "What do you want," and when we inquired about the food, he just pointed to the menu. We never felt offended, just taken aback by his gruffness.Now for the dish. There are two types of fish you can choose from. My companion and I decided to split the traditional cod. So glad we did because the fish was HUGE. Even after sharing, we couldn't finish the food. The batter of the fish had a nice solid crunch and was surprisingly not greasy! However, I thought the fish was bland and nothing extraordinary. Maybe I'm just not a fan of fish and chips?

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Look how dense that fish is!!
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Fish (cod) and chips! HUGE

dKXcHAoBbWXpRowZUBvKtQ.text: I found this place after yelping for good fish and chips. This place is out of the tourist areas but it was one of the best chips and fish I have had when I was there. The portions were huge and they even have lunch specials. The service was good but they do close for a certain hour to prepare for the dinner rush. The meal was extremely filling and one of the places I would recommend for people visiting London.

dPMBsZT80AdP9QvgLgJXVA.text: I don't like fish and chips, but my friend really wanted to try fish and chips in London, so I searched up a place on Yelp, and we decided to try Masters given its great reviews and proximity to the London Eye (which we had wanted to ride later that evening).I still don't like fish and chips, but if you do, I'd absolutely recommend Masters Super Fish. Really low prices, very fresh fish, and enormous portions. My friend and I split the cod and chips, and we didn't finish. They also bring out some cold shrimp to start, which we didn't eat, but I thought it was a nice touch.It also seems to be more of a local spot than a tourist one. I'm not sure if the guys next to us were just pulling our legs, but they were really amused to see us there and hear us speak (since we were clearly not British). They told us they'd been coming here weekly for 15 years and this was really a local spot, so they wondered how we had found it (thank you, Yelp!).

m1-_8-pfbngh4qdeA_6ecA.text: Just visited last night which was my last night in London. I set out to find a good place to get fish and chips and this place delivered in a big way. I asked the waiter what was the dish ordered the most which happened to be the Cod fish and chips. The food was delivered piping hot. Fish was cooked perfectly. Huge portion. Not greasy at all. And the fries were some of the best that I have ever eaten. I'm not sure how they were made but they appeared to be fresh cut and fried potatoes. Perfectly cooked. I was very pleased with my last meal in London. Highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Don't let this simple facade fool you. Food inside is out of this world awesome.
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips!!!  This is the most popular dish and it was outstanding. Fish cooked perfectly. Fries were outstanding!

I6AsiVvAuqMu-neXStDOKg.text: I ordered the mixed fish and chips plate. The serving was huge and I couldn't finish it all so I asked them if I could get my left overs for takeaway. My waitress was actually pretty rude and gave me faces when I asked for this option. Maybe it's not so common to ask for a to-go box in the UK, but I didn't think the attitude was necessary.I thought the fish was pretty good, but the chips were not so great. This is a good place to just try fish and chips when visiting London, but I wouldn't highly recommend for regular eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom

qazRHm3Xu5Ysj_VTQ1HKxA.text: For 5£ I had the best fish and chips of my life. One block over from my H10 Waterloo hotel. Love this place. Got take out and enjoyed it in my hotel. The fish is huge and super crisp and delicious. The portions are huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. COD and chips!
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Yum yum yum. Get the cod!

wHnTErq_6FpP3GvLXngpow.text: Ever have one of those days where you get off work, sprint to catch the bus, only to find you've gotten on the wrong one and need to get off? This was the situation which confronted me this evening; however, I realized that soon the bus would pass by 'Masters of the SuperFish', a shop I have been meaning to try for ages, and I could get takeaway and walk home afterwards.However, when confronted with the menu I flaked out and ordered skate wings. Now, I have caught skate by mistake many a time while deep sea fishing and never once decided to keep it, but for some reason this evening I said, 'what the heck' and ordered it.  This is a mistake that I made so that you won't have to- let's just say that maybe if one was sitting down with a fork and knife it could potentially have been a decent choice, but in case there was any lingering doubt, as an on-the-road takeaway, skate is not a recommended choice.Price was very very reasonable, chips were good and freshly made, service was quick and no-nonsense.

BOCvfxp1WlprKCcxLFIUlw.text: Great price, quick, simple.  Easy takeout.  Decent fish and chips.  Don't recommend the mushy peas, though... they tasted, honestly, like cigarette ash. :(

a_kCkgH6p19yF3-3TH2ZBw.text: Looking for an authentic fish and chips experience, we trekked out to Master's in hopes of golden crispy batter and crunchy chips. Did not find that at Master's. The fried coating turned soggy after about a minute and the chips were too starchy and dense.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. inside of the fish
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. fish (cod) and chips
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. interior of the restaurant

9Wi-yvscuS0SSL6aA-MDdw.text: Delicious! We had the cod filet and chips.  The batter was so crispy and light, fish was fresh and meaty. Great service, friendly! Even gave some recommendations for other spots to eat while in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Delicious cod filet and chips.

ovqEr0eUfJ2RuUD-YHiwCQ.text: Master Superfish is delicious and you get a lot for your money! The last time I was in London, I tried either really cheap or really pricey fish & chips places... so it was always not great or simply overpriced. I think Master Superfish is a good compromise. Don't expect a cutesy shop or anything like that though... the interior is more like a school cafeteria. There's probably going to be be a bit of a wait for your food but it's worth it for the huge portions and tasty fish. Prawns are complimentary, as well as bread & butter. We got the Master's special (cod) and it was 9.50 and came with plenty of chips. I also ordered the calamari appetizer for 4.50. When the food came, I was astonished at how humongous the portions were. This was no "multiple-piece" meal. The cod was one huge filet that took up the majority of the plate. My friend ordered something similarly sized and the two of us only managed to finish maybe less than half of what we'd ordered. The fish was fresh and very tasty, though after a while I got sick of the fried batter and started to peel a bit of it off. Definitely worth a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Cod & chips

Zo9vnFisBy2dTIqthYk0DQ.text: A great no nonsense fish and chip restaurant and takeaway. The portions are HUGE and always cooked perfectly; crispy batter with no soggy bits, perfectly flakey fish and lightly browed thick-cut chips. They are without a doubt 10/10 and I've eaten this English delicacy in most places around the UK. The price is also really reasonable for the amount and quality of the food.The restaurant area is great in my opinion. Completely basic, but it adds to the authenticity of the greasy spoon feel and after all you're coming here for the food and not a 5 star dining experience. Last time I went for a takeaway and the man serving me was an absolute grump, but who cares, this is a chippy love, not The Ivy. If you go without any expectations and just eat it's a great place. This may sound strange to tourists, but the British relationship with fish and chips calls for this kind of low key delivery. For something that used to be eaten out of old newspaper sheets (the hot oil would allow toxic ink to seep into the food) anything too fine would somehow spoil the tradition.What I also like is that the customers really vary from locals to workmen to post theatre goers in the evenings so it's actually a great atmosphere and always packed. It has a big following.The only reason I knocked one star off is because they have a sign proclaiming that they fry in ground nut oil and yet you can clearly see giant vats of vegetable oil behind the counter. Peanut oil is a healthier choice compared to commercial use veg oil, which is usually a blend of all sorts of yak. But once in a while, these are some of the best fish 'n' chips going south of the river.

bU3rjlrkADp31FrBsoVDNA.text: Came seeking fish & chips in London and glad we chose this place. Very nice staff and simple but straightforward food. Ordered cod & chips with mushy peas and English tea, finished everything on the plate. Price was down to earth as well. Definitely recommend it to anyone looking for fish & chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Cod & chips with mushy peas and English tea, Masters Super Fish

fv4aXzfJVIDLwz75Z91OkQ.text: I was staying at the Travelodge in Waterloo while attending a conference.  I knew while I was in London, I needed to track down some decent fish and chips, so I hopped on Yelp to find a place, hopefully nearby.  I really lucked out, because Masters Super Fish was pretty much next door to my hotel.  I was seeing a show later in the evening at the Old Vic, which is also down the road from Masters Super Fish, so I stopped in around 5, shortly after they opened.  One side of the the restaurant is a Chinese take-out place where you can order the fish to go during the day.  The sit down restaurant is only open in the evening.It was not crowded, at all, with only a few blue haired ladies a few tables over.  Like other reviews have said, the bring you some bread and some cold shrimp (prawns) as an appetizer.  The shrimp was ok, but it didn't taste fresh, more like it had been frozen then cooked, then chilled.  I ordered the fried haddock and chips.  I wasn't a fan of the chips, but it may be cultural thing.  I prefer more French style skinnier, crispy frites rather than thick, blander chips.  But I really came here for the fish, not the chips.  I thoroughly enjoyed my fried fish.  It was lightly battered and fried.  It didn't feel or taste greasy at all, which I appreciated.  The fish was a large portion and I didn't really have the appetite to try anything else.  I am not an expert on fish and chips, but I was quite satisfied with my experience here.  It was good and reasonably priced, which I came to find out in London is somewhat rare.

b5ch5Zth1edYTHT_WMywYg.text: This will always be my go to spot when I am in town. It really is a local gem that doesn't look very nice outside but truly made up for it in value and quality. When I discovered this place there was a takeout line going outside full of locals ( including police and if you see police eating there you know it's good) and I shared a table with an older Londoner who was very nice and even gave me tips about London. The shrimp and bread was a bit strange but the fish and chips were everything you would expect from a proper fish n chips place. Huge portions for a great value makes this place the best fish n chips place in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Fish n chips

VFPGfZwEXsZfQRXHgrUTwQ.text: Shrimp appetizer was good. Fish was great, large and not oily! Service was fast, will definitely be back if we can make it to this area again!

kExkreFt44A0RCQ47gB6WQ.text: We checked into our hotel and found that this place was highly recommended by locals, yelp, and the hotel staff so rushed over there at 3pm. They close at 330 but were nice enough to serve us even though they were only open for 30 minutes. I ordered the lunch special of classic fish and chips with a side of coleslaw. My friend ordered a mustard fish and chips, and the other ordered grilled fish and chips! First, they bring you incredibly soft bread and whole shrimp as an appetizer. I dont really eat bread, but it was so soft and good I ate probably 3 pieces. The shrimp was good too but being a whole shrimp its a lot of work. My fish was huge and still had the skin on it even though it was battered! The fries were good too but their slaw and tartar sauce really pushed the place over the edge for me. It was by far the best fish and chips I have ever had, even from another place in london too that was highly recommended. My friends Lemon fish and chips was even better than what I ordered so get that if you go there. The meal was also relatively inexpensive but a great value overall!

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips!
