Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom

jOU4wti3m3R-piTg8hC2sw.text: This is definitely a place you should visit. MS rolls out the full experience with prawns and pickles just like the picture shows for everyone. Super low key. Lots of locals but everyone is welcome.Huge menu to go for but I got the standard fish and chips.My only critique would be the fish is to deeply fried. I think this is either a style thing or old school but I like mine a little lighter so I can eat the fry versus flake half of it off like I did here.Good stuff all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom

MRPJRB1reHQT40uKFof7cg.text: Great value. Long menu. Giant portion. You can't go wrong. It's a fairly local spot so I reckon it's one of the better places to have fish and chips.Zero service. I was annoyed that the lady kept going to tables that were seated after us and serviced them before coming to us. But I know she was overwhelmed. Please hire more people!

lk529jg7KI43gdVk8BVL_g.text: Masters Superfish was my first experience with proper British fish & chips, and I have to say- it was delicious! The fried cod (the obvious star) was extra crispy on the outside, while the fish remained nice a moist on the inside. The lunch portion was served with fries, chilled shrimp, pickled onions and dill pickles. They offer several sides which you can add to your order including coleslaw and mashed peas. The restaurant itself is quite small, but filled with lots of seating. The overall feel is not of fine dining, but of good family memories made together over years of visiting a staple establishment. This was a fun experience. And I hope to visit again in the years to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Huge helping of fish & chips
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Shrimp appetizers and dinner accouterments
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Dining area

u49TRp6yOj-gXG-yPpxJoQ.text: Best fish & chips in London. Way cheaper than most restaurants but so delicious! I could eat there everyday.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom

ec5KOj0UEesHnCsM2SNI3Q.text: Masters Superfish serves the best fish and chips I've ever had in my life. I know it's that's a bold statement but it's true. The fish&chips are served fresh and crispy. The added shrimp was also a nice surprise to my meal. The restaurant itself is slightly above hole-in-the-wall. There were large parties, families sharing a meal, and also folks eating solo. It seems to be a place where locals come by. And if I remember correctly, currencies from around the world are taped onto the wall. For some reason, I can't find this restaurant on Yelp when I search it's name in London. Luckily I was able to find it from past searches, but there must be an error because it says it's located in London but the maps pinpoint it in Paris. Odd. Can somebody from this establishment and/or Yell figure this out? I'd hate for guests to miss out on this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Error in locating Masters Superfish. It says London but it's pinpointed in Paris. It's undetectable in Yelp searches.
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Large enough to share between two people in my opinion

wdkh9JkM-6wXqPj4wDaw7w.text: This place serves the best fish and chips in London, in my humble opinion. Located adjacent form my hotel in London, I had dinner or a snack here almost everyday. Guys in there are friendly and always made sure I had my malt vinegar for my fries and fish. If you're ever in London, check them out. I know I will when I go back

5XAZPSFRS2RmdcVCXjlaXw.text: We wanted a quick place, walking distance from our hotel to grab a bite to eat. Masters Superfish was recommended to us  and was about  2 blocks from our hotel so no-brainer. The place is really small, cozy and a total tourist trap. I should mention that I don't particularly care for fish and chips, but it was my first time in London, so I had to try it. They start you out with bread and shrimp. I ordered their coffee, which surprisingly was my favorite part of the meal. It was strong and very much needed after a 10+ hour flight. Cheap, quick service, filled the craving, but not coming back any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

OCVpaw-bHPwmE_YLwFd8IQ.text: Second time here, just as good as the first (a few years ago).Meal starts out with a basket of bread and butter along with a few (cold) boiled shrimp.  You can peel and eat 'em while you wait for the main dish to arrive!A very reasonably priced cod fish-n-chips meal for around £10 consisting of a large fried fish fillet, chips, mushy peas and a soft drink.  Their tartar sauce is tangy and pairs great with the freshly fried cod.  Chips were cooked perfectly.We left feeling very full and satisfied for the rest of our tour of the city.  A bit off the beaten path, but worth the effort to seek this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Restaurant exterior
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Cod fish-n-chips with mushy peas
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Complimentary...while you wait!

DoOaaeYDDzHlXpNpnjEeiQ.text: I typically look for hole-in-the-wall spots to get fish & chips when I'm in London.  When you see locals, particularly road crew workers, in these spots, you know you're going to get quality for a good price.  This was a "fully licensed" hole in the wall with lots of superlatives in the title, so I was hopeful. I was a little apprehensive when nearly all the tables were empty at noon, but I hoped that since it was a weekend, workers wouldn't be out so that would explain all the empty tables.  I should have known that when I saw the giant map with pins marking where people originated to enjoy their fish as well as all of the foreign currency on the walls that this was a joint that fed off of people passing through, not necessarily a local point of preference.I grabbed a seat and placed an order for f&c with mushy peas. Food was brought out super fast!  Like, freaky fast.  Beside my order was a small basket of bread and butter and a small bowl with 3 prawns.  I don't know how to attack the prawns, so they went to waste, but everything else was sampled.  The fish wasn't bad, but it certainly wasn't among the best I've had.  It wasn't exceptionally flaky and the battering tasted bland.  They do bring out a vat of tartar sauce, though, so that added a good bit of flavor.  The chips were inconsistent, some of them limp while others were so crunchy that I was worried about my molars.  Service started out great, but dropped off precipitously after the food was delivered.  Not terrible, but I don't think I'll be making it back to Master's on my next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Place is money.  Read: lots of tourists come through
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Good amount of food for the price

1SKVNXX1d-L7wJlAvyYQZg.text: We stopped by here after visiting some popular tourist attractions such as Buckingham palace and Big Ben. This was a great meal to share after a long day of walking around London. In addition to your meal, they serve a plate of prawns.

TdNYC_8j1_NEKb0nzLaS8Q.text: As all the other reviews state, they prepare fish and chips to perfection.  The batter is crispy and not greasy, and it's served piping hot - we got it within minutes of it coming out of the frier.  We ordered one plate of the fish and chips and one of the fried calamari.  The calamari was cooked perfectly; tender and not chewy at all.  Also, considering how large the portions were, the prices were very reasonable. The restaurant and its decor were nothing special, and the servers aren't out of their way friendly, but they don't need to be.  They do their job of serving you delicious fish and chips and they do it very well.  If you're looking to indulge in this British classic, it'd be worth your while to drop by this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Classic fish and chips.

vpv7zu6cBB7ir1weJpdK-w.text: Food: 4/5Service: 4/5Cleanliness: 3/5Decor & Style: 3/5The Fish and Chips are good but nothing worth going out of my way for. Family run'd place. Portions are large and inexpensive.  Decor and style is out of date. If I lived in this hood or was in the area I would come back, otherwise I would try some other place.

xluo5bKbe11Jj_O3l4HjWw.text: Oh my word... The fish...Ooooh so flaky and tasty.. Easily one of the best fishes I've had in London and so much of it for £5! Yessssss, I've found my place! The chips I ordered were big and fluffy, but on eating them, left a really strange taste in my mouth. At 50p when served with the fish, it hardly breaks the bank, but I think next time I'll give them a swerve and order some good old fashioned mushy peas.All in all though, this is as cheap and chips and one of the best chippies you'll find in London. If you want a cheap lunch, you can even sit inside and eat for a £5. Double win.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Cod and chips

mICAQEg7bU7YoNTZaxMlCg.text: 5 stars for the food, 1 star for the rude service, but it's sort of our fault.Disclaimer: I don't have much experience eating in London, and am not used to separate lines for takeaway vs dining in.Upon entering the building, there's a small counter with a chalkboard menu and a door off to the right that opens into a room with seating. As a naive American, I assumed that customers order at the counter, and then take their food to the adjoining room to eat. We ordered the Master's special which was posted on the chalkboard and 10 minutes later we were handed a hot steaming bundle of freshly fried fish and chips, wrapped in paper, with the grease just starting to ooze out. We took the bundle and entered the dining room, but the guy behind the counter yelled at us to get out, saying that our order was for takeaway only. We pleaded ignorance and offered to pay the difference, but the dude shook his head and pointed towards the door.  It was pouring rain when we arrived, but fortunately, it stopped. We stood outside in the 45 degree (8 Celcius?) cold and ate the fish and chips. I have a big appetite, but I have to say that a single order was enough to fill both of us up. It was an enormous amount of grease, but the fish was super flaky and tasty, and the chips were large and crisp. Perhaps the best fish and chips I've ever had. However, being forced to eat outside standing in the cold really detracted from the experience, but it is kind of memorable in its own way.

fvCXqFyNeHt_UZBjeI22SA.text: Authentic fish and chips!!! So flavorful and crispy! I stayed right down the block from this place and pretty much ordered from them everyday!

uzh9mJaIidkVoUiWMSpSdw.text: Good food. convenient location. Good beer. Consistent quality. Thumbs up!

9JhZ6hQ7fQhiZB9Jc3R3YA.text: The food was great, got the mustard fried cod, it was cooked well and tasted fresh.The atmosphere was pleasant, the service was fast, and the portions were huge! It is my first time in London, and this was the first place I went to for a meal, will definitely be coming back during the duration of my visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masters Superfish - London, United Kingdom. Store front.

CelqWnGrpL-cQvdWhK1L2w.text: I hate writing bad reviews on yelp since I support small business restaurants but I have to complain about this one.  We went here because my wife and I really wanted some authentic fish and chips. Before our dinner, we poured the bottle of malt vinegar that was on our table and out came fruit flies!  There must of been 5 to 10 of them in our bottle.  The waitress was very sweet and explained that they refill their bottles every night but obviously don't clean them out as well.  This is not OK when you there are certain health regulations that businesses have to abide by. Our meals were ruined nonetheless. I do have to say that our server was nice and seemed to have empathy for our experience.Be wary when you visit establishments like this or you could be eating flies with your meal!

H2nPQQc45RdiOVnWZcv8Qw.text: Visited on Saturday 8/13/16 and it was a small crowd half full place.  Seems like a small family run joint and for sure the portion sizes plus fresh fish and chicken as why these reviews are so good.I had the cod and chips for lunch and the family had the chicken and chips.  Both worth the very reasonable price.  Definitely left feeling stuffed from a big lunch.  Good for adults and kids alike.

K6wxMsWqmwg8SWBoYcrn4Q.text: A quick google search will show that Master's Superfish is one of the most popular of the hundreds of Fish and Chips shops in London and since I live near by, I had to give it a try. The fish was definitely a step up from your usual chippies with a very nice delicate batter covering a tender filet of cod. I also liked the extra touches. Every meal comes with complimentary french bread and butter and starts with three peel and eat whole shrimp. I would caution that the shrimp may not be for everyone though. The ones that came to our table were loaded with shrimp eggs which were a big turn off for my friend, though didn't bother me too much. Also, during the meal, the waiter comes by with a selection of pickles to compliment the meal. The pickled onions were excellent and a great fresh accompaniment to the stodgy fare of a fish & chip supper. My only concern was with the chips, which were a bit hard on the inside, indicating they needed to be cooked a bit longer. The service was also very basic, with not much interaction or friendliness on the part of the wait staff. Price-wise, I think the value is spot on, with the meal coming with bread, shrimp, fish, chips, pickled gherkins and onions coming to just over 8 pounds. All in all, this is definitely a good place if you're craving fish and chips, though I don't know if its worth a trip out of the way.Takeaway also available...

6tOpTHTv1R7CAjoKg-6Vyw.text: Delicious fish, HUGE portions, and reasonable prices. Even cheaper if you order take out. Definitely going back!!

R7G5C11yJHkkdc52il9Iqw.text: Seemed more like a local spot for dining instead of touristy. Very English. The fish and chips were in ample portion. The fish was flaky just as it should be. Chips were golden and perfect. You can get a half order of chips and a salad for just a bit more. At 8 pounds for fish and chips, we were very happy! A glass of house wine is 30 pence less than a glass of water, so you might as well go for it! Oh and they served boiled shrimp with bread and butter to whet ours palate before our order arrived. Great little find!

ce-0-IqIdTvNdLPPaMR31A.text: What4 Shell-Prawns, Picked Onions, Gherkins  ComplimentaryAll dine-in customers received a few prawns and some bread and butter to tide them over until the main event arrived. We appreciated this as our mustard and pepper fish took a very long time to prepare. Onions and gherkins were chilled, crunchy and vinegary. Masters Skate Fried in Pepper  £9.25 (includes chips)This huge fleshy skate wing was covered in a fine black pepper and fried perfectly, the dense flakes peeled wonderfully off the spiny bones making the crispy skin and juicy skate a delicious mouthful. The pepper crust would have hugely benefited from seasoning with salt and lemon as this had to be liberally and constantly applied. Because of the density of the fish and it's peppery jacket the skate retained heat, the last bite as delicious as the first. Masters Cod Fried in Mustard  £9.50 (includes chips)The strong mustard flavour worked perfectly with chunky cod and was seasoned very well, we preferred this dish to the skate as there was less hassle with self-seasoning. Chips on both were good, crispy but lacking a smooth puffy interior. We ordered haddock but they only had cod left, with cod depletion issues it is a shame it was not the other way round. Mixed Salad  £2.00We were too full for this so it came home with us. Even so it was not the most appealing salad, a few leaves, grated carrot, tomatoes and tonnes of sliced raw onion. Mushy Peas  £1.50Chunky, thick and tasty, served in a sensible sized portion for two to share. The addition of salt, vinegar and pepper made it irresistible and it was finished off pretty quickly. Drink4 Pots of Tea  £4.00Tea was fine but the milk was UHT and spoilt the taste. AtmosphereWe sat in but there is also a takeaway window for speedy visits. The dining room is clean (if a little chilly) and showcases a wonderful mix of customers. We joined single cabbies who all seemed to order the Master Special (247g prime cod), a family, a couple and a few business men with overnight trolleys straight from Waterloo station (3 mins walk away). OffersLunch Special  Cod/Plaice/Huss with tea or coffee/soft drink  £6.50/£7.00 (with chips) VerdictWe will definitely return when we feel we can take the calories of a battered fish. Looking at other tables made us pretty jealous as the majority had ordered the huge crunchy fish that curled up off their plates however we really enjoyed our meal and left satisfied.

bqvL1HYB4ILdiC7cSj7TKw.text: I personally believe that this is the best fish and chips Ive eaten in the past 2 years that I have been living in the UK. They use groundnut oil to fry in, cut fredh potatoes for the chips and make their own gerkins and pickeled onions....my husband and I love it!

744v2uuAdPPPj2r7JPOSZg.text: Went here on recommendation from the hotel we were staying at and so happy we did the Fish and Chips were brilliant. Server was spot on and very helpful and will return on our next trip to London.

N9gW6KRCkZMk7iV65YSqGg.text: As close to the best fish and chips as London gets. Shattering batter, brilliant fat chips, and pickles to go round. I could eat here every Friday night and be happy. Not as cheap as it gets, but hey, neither's cod any more.

WNqQXc6VKqcSKnVkifw_DA.text: Fantastic fish and chips, I've visted this place many times and it's certainly the best I've found in London. Their fish comes fresh every day from the fish market and they use ground nut oil which gives the fish a lovely flavour. The portions are large and the fillets are always big and chunky, especially the 'masters special' which is an enormous cod fillet. There is a sit down restaurant which is usually frequented by a good mix of locals, cabbies (always a good sign) and business people / tourists, and they also have a takeaway which has hundreds of old event tickets and football match tickets pinned to the walls which I always find fascinating to look at while I wait for my order (they always cook to order so everything is fresh). Prices are a bit on the high side but it's London and worth paying the extra for guaranteed good quality. Highly recommend.

VwBxhZglkl8k0FgmgnVZYQ.text: I don't think fish and chips can get any better than this. Crusty and yet wet inside. Not to greasy and the portions are great for its price. Well worth going!

j8X9Nl0nR-Mg0mJM-642yQ.text: A take-away price of £7.50 for a huge portion of crispy deep fried fish goujons and even more delicious chips, plus a side of decently mushed mushy peas and a more-than-enough cupful of tangy home-made tartar sauce makes a cheap, cheerful, and absolutely delicious dinner for two.

Cpsha8Gtjzf8Wp1xN08rdw.text: Mmmmmmmm.... the best fish and chips I've had in a very long time. The large sized cod was lightly deep fried to perfection. The fried outer layer was light and crisp and cod was tender and juicy. The fish was fresh as it didn't taste fishy. The fries were lightly fried and it didn't taste too oily which was a good thing. The mushy peas was great too!

OQXz-rprUTxFgLiOkRbsFQ.text: Divey fish and chips place. Huge platter of your choice of fish (I recommend cod if you have never had fish and chips before). big, heaping amounts of fries (aka chips), plus onions and pickles. If you are visiting London, and want real fish and chips, this is the place to go.

e_cSWVCWLWHlt2_x2YLeDg.text: In my opinion, to cook fish is really hard and takes professionalism and lots of experience to make the meat smooth and tasty. This restaurant dangerously closes to the perfect fish place in London. I was so impressed by my stay here that I decided to compliment the guys here. Delicious meals and friendly staff  definite recommendation.

KbjDiHQYIYke_0Y_8Up0pg.text: Coming from state side, you always hear about fish and chips. So while visiting a friend, I told him to take me to the best fish and chips place that you know of.  Lord know this had to be on top of his list.  The Cod was battered perfectly and the texture of the fish was moist and flaky that it left your mouth wanting more.   The atmosphere isn't that of a fancy design or high class.  But if you want a great bite this is the spot to be!

1ouvYY1Yro9xceQHokIDLg.text: Like R.C. I'm also reviewing as a tourist (however Canadian and well versed in the fish and chips school of thought). I chose Master because it not only came highly recommended as an delish and financially reasonable, it was also in the area I was staying - Southwark. Close to several theatres and bars, including the Old Vic, and not very far from South Bank at all, Master Superfish is definitely a local go-to for HUGE portions of tasty fish with perfectly seasoned batter. Don't expect attention to decor or exception service (in fact, expect the opposite) but I suppose when you get a piece of fish the length of your arm (and this is the small size) for 8 pounds, you certainly can't complain about anything else. I will say that although my waitress was very friendly, the cashier/other waitress, could not be more rude - unprovoked.Wait, I have yet to describe the fixings - each meal comes with 4 unpeeled prawns, picked onions, huge gherkins and a mini sauce cart. Bold face statement: the best fish and chips I have ever had. Master Superfish, has ruined me for Canada's Pacific Halibut forever.

4rXAg1unIzUWURRkauuJJg.text: Huge portions, had the delicious cod; flaky, moist, flavorful with perfect crisp outer crust.  Chips we equally great - crisp and well done.  Space was cozy and a little tight, but clean and and friendly.  Would definitely go back again!

F9rX1jRW9koU6Y30JRCVvQ.text: I would have checked in if not for WiFi. They don't have it. They are missing a few things like obviously stated, a in house ambiance. I recommend getting your food to go honestly getting service was slower than if I had caught the fish myself. My fish had skin on it, which was sadly a turn off. Why not filet the dam thing then bread it? I guess a yank doesn't get it. The stiff drinks were lacking in the stiff part. I made a request for mustard twice and was finally served something rather nice. The shrimp are whole, so be ready to get your hands dirty, with by the way nothing clean your hands on. Should have got the haddock my friend got. Much better than the cod for sure. The peas are mushy but poorly flavoured with nothing. So salt and pepper liberously. I was offered pickled onions and pickles. It was a ton of food and not a lot of room for the table. I left feeling rather greasy. Offordable yes, but honestly they do so little right it seems not worth it to try any other food. My partner has been left in bed with horrible stomach flu much to rivel Montezuma's revenge.

vtk6DiPsjMz5SjJskTlLmQ.text: Was on vacation with family in early April...And found Masters Super Fish on yelp. Saw it had great reviews so We decided to give it a shot and the reviews where accurate. The Food is delicious and well served. Also Good service. Give it a shot!

NImmwzAbtx8uUyzwnH063g.text: I came here with colleagues, both of whom live in England. They both recommended this place for fish and chips, and they were right. The fish comes in daily, and fries and fish are cooked to order. The batter was light, and the fish was not greasy. I had the Cod fish and chips. The chips had a nice, crisp flavor. This restaurant is not elegant by any means, this is about the food. It's not a pub or fancy restaurant - it is more like a diner in the US. I skipped the shrimp they brought out before dinner, preferring my shrimp to be headless and legless. You order at the counter or at your table, they cook it and bring it out to you. We also had mushy peas - I had never had them before, and they tasted a little like thick pea soup without any salt. It's an easy walk to the Waterloo station.

PhvKjDQkPHsvQfIhcLAk4g.text: Misled by these reviews. The fish had bones in it and had a bad fishy taste. They gave us a free appetizer of raw uncleaned shrimp that smelled.  The chips were good, so I give it one star for that.

Qnc00c-qqKHlvvAz0pPMfg.text: Dinner last night with my wife. Great cod f & c. Large quantities. If we come back i would split a Masters special or regular plate and try maybe the sticky toffee dessert and maybe share an appetizer also. The fish was super moist and light and crunchy on the outside but simply too much of just a couple good things (other is the massive quantity of chips). The few super small boiled shrimp they give you with the bread seemed odd and not stereotypically English f&c but maybe that's my ignorance of Engligh f&c? House white wine was nice with the cod.

s5f6swzeUU4NzhpJ5LYIWw.text: Visited London for a few days, and we heard that this was the place to go to for the best fish & chips.The place wasn't really much to look at, but the food was really delicious. If I lived in London, I would probably go eat here every week.

AU55GhZ33C58Hk-nq1Y6Eg.text: Disclaimer:  I visited this restaurant as an American tourist (who lives in Europe).Disclaimer of my disclaimer:  When it comes to restaurants on vacation, I do A LOT of research.If you want the fish and chips experience, find a decent pub and order the dish there.  However, if you want the best fish and chips in town, check out Masters Super Fish.  Although London is not known for the best fish and chips in the UK, this is the top place for fish and chips in London.  Fish is hot and moist while the batter is crisp and not soggy.  They have the traditional cod as well as various other types of fish both fried and grilled.  My wife and I both got the Masters Special which is a HUGE piece of cod with more chips than you know what to do with.  If you don't have a massive appetite and are going for the cod, just get the regular size.As a bonus, everyone gets 3 boiled shrimp as a free appetizer (along with bread and butter), and after your meal arrives you will be offered free pickles (gherkins).They also have a take-away window.

nP22QaWoen_muBnmp2TjeA.text: Ambiance: Diner, simple.Service: Attentive, friendly.Price:  £10 and upFood: Excellent fish and chips. Good assortment of other fish dishes providing variety. Charming free portion of prawns offered as an appetiser, as well as pickled whole onions and gherkinsSummary:  Hearty, real, and tasty!

3qrxCiTa2sqxPWocMcRVsg.text: MmMmmmmm. probably one of the best meal's I had in London. Being in London, my friends and I wanted to try the best fish and chips and after yelping away, my friend found master superfish! We got a bit lost getting there but it was worth it all in the end.We all ordered the lunch time special, fish and chips with tea. They give shrimps and bread as appetizers. I thought the shrimps to be a bit weird but the bread tasted good. The fish was nice and crisp.. not too oily like other places I've tried. The chips were also delicious... I couldn't help but keep eating even though I was pretty full. The owners also came around with pickled onions and pickles which tasted good with the fish as it gets rid of some of the oily-ness from eating fish and chips. I hope to go back again one day when I visit revisit LONDON!!!

0Cp3dBP7Y1TYhmEDZ36Ktw.text: The food was delicious. I ordered the traditional cod and was served bread and butter as well as 4 prawns (shrimp to all the Americans out there) while I waited. The chips were absolutely amazing! They were served piping hot and, after a generous dousing in malt vinegar and salt, I was in heaven! The fish was good, too. The breading had a good flavor and wasn't too heavy. For £7.50, you can't beat the excellence of this shop.

18OV7qSs450BTzHCpI3d3w.text: Took my teenage children today and we had a great meal, a very good quantity of food and the fish and the chips both tasted excellent, accompanied with prawns, bread, lots of sauces and nice tea or cool drinks. The price was great for such a big meal and the service and cooking were fast and good. Looking forward to our next chance to return there and know it will be long before we taste such good fish and chips elsewhere.

SRlA657ZR5BCSsLB6erbwQ.text: We went to Masters on the recommendation of a cabbie who described it as a hole-in-the-wall place with the best fin and chips.  It's just down the road from the Old Vic and Waterloo station, and the food was great. My partner, who lived in London as a child and went to local fish and chip places with her parents, said that her haddock was spot on. I had the calamari and it was great. The chips were fresh cut and were excellent, too.  This place is a definite recommendation from me.
